meanings.definition: The act of fastening or tying with cords.
meanings.sent1: She completed the cordings on the package to ensure it stayed closed during shipping.
meanings.sent2: The tent was securely held up by the cordings tied to the stakes.
meanings.sent3: The cordings on the gift were so tight that even a magician couldn't open it!
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like it was held together by fragile cordings, ready to snap at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The intricate cordings on the dress made it look like a work of art.

meanings.definition: A series of cords or ropes used for a specific purpose.
meanings.sent1: The cordings hanging from the ceiling were used to create a unique decoration.
meanings.sent2: The ship's rigging consisted of various cordings to control the sails.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the cordings were a fun toy to play with, causing chaos in the room.
meanings.sent4: The cordings of fate seemed to lead them together, no matter how they tried to resist.
meanings.sent5: The intricate knotting of the cordings showed the craftsmanship of the sailor.
